intro: Notocactus scopa f. xicoi, commonly known as the Xicoi Hedgecactus, is a unique hybrid plant native to Mexico. It is characterized by its dense, spiny stems that form a compact, shrub-like structure. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, adding a striking visual contrast to its green foliage. Its stems are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is a sought-after plant among cactus enthusiasts.
